definition: pre-Tang names of the five notes of the pentatonic scale, corresponding roughly to do, re, mi, sol, la
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
4th note in pentatonic scale 五音[wu3 yin1], roughly sol/see also 徵|征[zheng1]

five notes of pentatonic scale, roughly do, re, mi, sol, la/five classes of initial consonants of Chinese phonetics, namely: 喉音[hou2 yin1], 牙音[ya2 yin1], 舌音[she2 yin1], 齒音|齿音[chi3 yin1], 唇音[chun2 yin1]
music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
ocarina/wind instrument consisting of an egg-shaped chamber with holes
tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
